snippet: American officials say a mixed picture of Iran’s capabilities emerged after the country’s agents tried, but failed, to exploit public outrage over the burning of Korans by American troops.
abstract: American officials say Iran secretly ordered its agents in Afghanistan to exploit public outrage over the burning of Korans by American soldiers, though it has failed to provoke widespread or lasting unrest; officials say a mixed picture of Iranian capabilities has emerged, and see a pattern of malign meddling to increase the country's influence across the Middle East and South Asia.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER, ERIC SCHMITT and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker and Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: American officials say a mixed picture of Iran’s capabilities emerged after the country’s agents tried, but failed, to exploit public outrage over the burning of Korans by American troops.

headline.seo: Iran’s Efforts to Stir Afghan Violence Provoke Concern
headline.main: U.S. Sees Iran in Bids to Stir Unrest in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Iran In Bids to Stir Afghan Unrest
